Reviews.Title: Thoroughly Impressed
Reviews.Author: Spoogiewoogie
Reviews.Content: While on vacation I fell in love with my friend's canon powershot camera and decided once I got home to ditch my Nikon cool pix for a powershot. I am so happy I purchased this Sony cyber-shot camera instead!! It exceeded all my expectations and then some. The picture quality is exceptional, it shoots great videos, and has an easy mode to make usage a breeze. There are so many functions.  Overall this is an exceptional point and shoot. My only pet peve is th battery life is really short. Even with that defect I still give it a 5/5.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Micro USB cable same size as Kindle.
Reviews.Author: gillesjm
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Only had it a few hours, so not a lot of detail to add except that it seems to perform really, really well. take the time to run through its various features and options and you'll be glad you did. By the way, I've seen some comments on Q&A; sites wondering about how to find a replacement for the micro USB cable that comes with the camera. Its not a "normal" size, but I just found that it seems to be the same size as the micro USB cable for the Kindle! No problem finding those around. Problem solved! :-)

Reviews.Title: p. oberlander is gay!!!
Reviews.Author: Greg droddy
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!  Works great!!  Like any device they can break easily if you dont take care of them!  Thats what cases are for!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. Much better than the 3 Nikon Coolpix I had - all 3 of them broke (2 with the battery door and one with the screen). It's very reliable and has excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Love my Camera, but there's a downside to this one
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. It works perfectly well. the images are 10 times better quality than my other cameras. It has many features that are useful. sometimes using this camera, i feel like i have a DSLR already. Love the way it has the blur out function and many more. The only downside is that I lost my cable that connects the camera to the Comp or the charger. So My camera has been dead for months. I cannot charge my battery whatsoever. For this type of camera, you cannot find another USB cord that fits if you loose it. So i'm stuck having to buy another whole battery kit that's going to cost over $50. boooo

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: fabiana
Reviews.Content: The camera was very good. We are very happy with it. It has lots of functions and it`s easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Small but nice
Reviews.Author: Willy
Reviews.Content: Works very well, and very happy with it. Would recommend it to anyone. Hope all these words helps someone. good luck.

Reviews.Title: Would Choose Something Different
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Unimpressed. I have had a few digital cameras before and this has been my least favorite. Contrary to other people's reviews, I don't find it easy to use. I am not very camera savvy so that could greatly be my problem, but I find my pictures are always blurry. The 18.2 megapixels doesn't seem to be any significant improvement on my 12 and 14 megapixel cameras from before, so don't be drawn in to this camera just for that aspect. I've only had it a year but I am trying to get rid of it for something much more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great!
Reviews.Author: Arianna
Reviews.Content: This camera is just as I expected and meets all expectations as the descriptions provide. It takes crisp pictures and has nifty affects.

Reviews.Title: One of the best cameras I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Ronald F. Diehl Jr. "Camera Crazy..."
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best cameras i've ever owned...right now i have this Sony WX100, a Panasonic Lumix, a Canon DSLR (old school SLR) and a Nikon P100 super zoom...Loved my Lumix for the longest time but was going to Italy, Disney and Daytona and didn't want to lug around my SLR so i finally (after about a month and a half of shopping around and trying out cameras) settled on this one....with the glass (not plastic lens) and the crazy amount of options this camera far exceed my expectations....Easy to use...you have to kinda mess with it a little for indoor vs. outdoor settings...Figure if you want to use the P setting (programmable) or the Auto shot features....other than that (and once you get used to it) you'll love it.  Takes really great video as well...but hey it's a Sony so you kinda expect that.  I love the panoramic pics it takes as well.Can't get much better on a camera that fits in your pocket in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: Returning it tomorrow
Reviews.Author: Sari berry
Reviews.Content: I've been a life long Canon user, but thought I would change it up this time.  My 6 year old Canon takes so long to load that I miss shots of my 2 year old.  I thought this would be a great camera after reading the reviews.  All of our shots came out blurry.  My husband switched it to easy mode, but then everything seemed white washed and slightly distorted.  While I could take the photos quickly (which is what I need), they always came out blurry, no matter how still my husband and son are (and it's not easy to get a 2 year old to hold still).  The menu system is also complicated and I was really unimpressed by the "fun" features.  They all just seemed to blur the photos even more, and there are only 4 colors you can choose from for the color accent.  I purchased this a week ago and we have been trying it out, but it's going back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Sony disappoints again
Reviews.Author: P. Oberlander
Reviews.Content: I have had so many problems with Sony electronics in the past that I swore them off in 2005.  Radios(1 year), CD players(3 years), high-end CRT graphic monitor(3.1 years), a CRT television(4 years) that go out shortly after warranty expires.  I finally gave in after 7 years and bought this camera.  It does everything it is supposed to pretty well and the specs are great.However, as with past Sony products, it has a problem.  The display on the back is, evidently, not very tough.  I have had multiple point and shoot cameras.  I buy a new one every 2 years (Canon, Olympic, Nikon and Pentax) since 2000 to get the highest resolution.  My wife also does.  I have always put them in my pocket and never had a display break.  This happened with the Sony.  It isn't very tough.My next (insert product here) will not be a Sony.

ProductInfo.Features:
18.2-megapixel 1/2.3" Exmor R CMOS sensor
10x optical/20x clear image zoom
2.7" Clear Photo LCD
HD movie mode
3D still image and 3D Sweep Panorama modes
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX100 18.2-Megapixel Digital Camera - Black
